00001 # Name:    preferences.tcl
00002 # Author:  Trevor Williams  (phase1geo@gmail.com)
00003 # Date:    5/13/2013
00004 # Brief:   Namespace for handling preferences
00005 
00006 namespace eval preferences {
00007 
00008   source [file join $::tke_dir lib ns.tcl]
00009   
00010   variable base_preferences_file [file join $::tke_dir data preferences.tkedat]
00011   variable user_preferences_file [file join $::tke_home preferences.tkedat]
00012   
00013   array set loaded_prefs {}
00014   array set prefs        {}
00015   
00016   ######################################################################
00017   # Returns the preference item for the given name.
00018   proc get {name} {
00019   
00020     variable prefs
00021     
00022     return $prefs($name)
00023     
00024   }
00025   
00026   ######################################################################
00027   # Called whenever the current text is changed.  Reloads the preferences
00028   # based on the given set of preferences.
00029   proc update_prefs {} {
00030     
00031     variable loaded_prefs
00032     variable prefs
00033     
00034     # Load the user prefs
00035     array set temp_prefs $loaded_prefs(user)
00036     
00037     # Load language-specific preferences
00038     if {([set txt [[ns gui]::current_txt {}]] ne "") && \
00039         ([set language [[ns syntax]::get_current_language $txt]] ne "None") && \
00040         [info exists loaded_prefs($language)]} {
00041       array set temp_prefs $loaded_prefs($language)
00042     }
00043     
00044     # Remove any preferences that have not changed value
00045     foreach {name value} [array get temp_prefs] {
00046       if {[info exists prefs($name)] && ($prefs($name) eq $temp_prefs($name))} {
00047         unset temp_prefs($name)
00048       }
00049     }
00050     
00051     # Set the preferences
00052     array set prefs [array get temp_prefs]
00053     
00054   }
00055   
00056   ######################################################################
00057   # Loads the preferences file
00058   proc load {} {
00059   
00060     # Load the preferences file contents
00061     load_file
00062     
00063   }
00064   
00065   ######################################################################
00066   # Adds the global preferences file as a readonly file.
00067   proc view_global {} {
00068     
00069     variable base_preferences_file
00070     
00071     [ns gui]::add_file end $base_preferences_file -readonly 1 -sidebar 0
00072     
00073   }
00074   
00075   ######################################################################
00076   # Adds the user preferences file to the editor, auto-reloading the
00077   # file when it is saved.
00078   proc edit_user {} {
00079     
00080     variable user_preferences_file
00081     
00082     [ns gui]::add_file end $user_preferences_file -sidebar 0 -savecommand preferences::load_file
00083     
00084   }
00085   
00086   ######################################################################
00087   # Adds the specified language preferences file to the editor, auto-reloading
00088   # the file when it is saved.
00089   proc edit_language {} {
00090     
00091     set language [[ns syntax]::get_current_language [[ns gui]::current_txt {}]]
00092     
00093     [ns gui]::add_file end [file join $::tke_home preferences.$language.tkedat] -sidebar 0 -savecommand "preferences::load_file $language"
00094     
00095   }
00096   
00097   ######################################################################
00098   # Constantly monitors changes to the tke preferences file.
00099   proc load_file {{language ""}} {
00100   
00101     variable base_preferences_file
00102     variable user_preferences_file
00103     variable loaded_prefs
00104     variable prefs
00105     variable menus
00106     
00107     # If the preferences file does not exist, add it from the data directory
00108     if {[file exists $user_preferences_file]} {
00109       
00110       # Get the file status information for both the base and user files
00111       file stat $base_preferences_file base_stat
00112       file stat $user_preferences_file user_stat
00113       
00114       # Read the user preferences file
00115       if {![catch { [ns tkedat]::read $user_preferences_file } rc]} {
00116         array set user_prefs $rc
00117       }
00118       
00119       # If the base preferences file was changed since the user file has changed, see if the
00120       # user file needs to be updated and update it if necessary
00121       if {$base_stat(mtime) > $user_stat(mtime)} {
00122 
00123         # Read both the base the preferences file
00124         if {![catch { [ns tkedat]::read $base_preferences_file } rc]} {
00125           array set base_prefs $rc
00126         }
00127         
00128         # If the preferences are different between the base and user, update the user
00129         if {[lsort [array names base_prefs]] ne [lsort [array names user_prefs]]} {
00130           
00131           # Copy only the members in the user preferences that are in the base preferences
00132           # (omit the comments)
00133           foreach name [array names user_prefs] {
00134             if {[info exists base_prefs($name)] && ([string first ",comment" $name] == -1)} {
00135               set base_prefs($name) $user_prefs($name)
00136             }
00137           }
00138           
00139           # Write the base_prefs array to the user preferences file
00140           if {![catch {[ns tkedat]::write $user_preferences_file [array get base_prefs]} rc]} {
00141             set loaded_prefs(user) [array get base_prefs]
00142           }
00143           
00144         # Otherwise, assign the user preferences to the 
00145         } else {
00146           set loaded_prefs(user) [array get user_prefs]
00147         }
00148         
00149       # Otherwise, just use the user preferences file
00150       } else {
00151         set loaded_prefs(user) [array get user_prefs]
00152       }
00153         
00154     } else {
00155         
00156       # Copy the base preferences to the user preferences file
00157       copy_default 0
00158        
00159       # Read the contents of the user file
00160       if {![catch { [ns tkedat]::read $user_preferences_file } rc]} {
00161         set loaded_prefs(user) $rc
00162       }
00163         
00164     }
00165     
00166     # Read the language preference file
00167     if {$language ne ""} {
00168       set languages $language
00169     } else {
00170       set languages [list]
00171       foreach lang_file [glob -nocomplain -directory $::tke_home -tails preferences.*.tkedat] {
00172         if {[regexp {preferences\.(.*)\.tkedat} $lang_file -> lang]} {
00173           lappend languages $lang
00174         }
00175       }
00176     }
00177     
00178     # Save off settings from each language
00179     foreach lang $languages {
00180       if {![catch { [ns tkedat]::read [file join $::tke_home preferences.$lang.tkedat] } rc]} {
00181         set loaded_prefs($lang) $rc
00182       }
00183     }
00184     
00185     # Update the preferences
00186     update_prefs
00187     
00188     # Perform environment variable setting from the General/Variables preference option
00189     [ns utils]::set_environment $prefs(General/Variables)
00190     
00191   }
00192   
00193   ######################################################################
00194   # Copies the default preference settings into the user's tke directory.
00195   proc copy_default {{load 1}} {
00196   
00197     variable base_preferences_file
00198     
00199     # Copy the default file to the tke_home directory
00200     file copy -force $base_preferences_file $::tke_home
00201     
00202     # Load the preferences file
00203     if {$load} {
00204       load_file
00205     }
00206     
00207   }
00208   
00209 }
